**Machine Gun Ammunition Pouch - Tender Notice**
**Reference Number**: W8476-226544/A
**Publication Date**: April 4, 2024
**Closing Date and Time**: April 23, 2024, at 14:00 hours

**Notice Intent:**
This is an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) published by Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) for the supply of ammunition pouches for the Canadian Forces 7.62 mm General Purpose Machine Gun (GPMG).

**Official Title**: The Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) pertain to this procurement.

**Description:**
The Department of National Defence requires an ammunition pouch to be designed, manufactured, and delivered under this contract. The pouch must meet the following requirements:

* Hold up to 50 rounds of linked 7.62 x 51mm ammunition
* Attach to the GPMG on the existing Feed Box Button
* Allow the operator to link a full belt of ammunition to the short belt stowed within the pouch for continuous firing
* Remain attached to the GPMG when the top feed cover assembly and feed tray are open
* Be reusable and have metal components hard anodized or painted black to prevent corrosion
* Have fabric components made of high-tenacity, textured nylon polyurethane-coated material according to MIL-DTL-32439A (1000D) Class 3 Water Repellant Back-coated fabric Style A Coyote 498

**Procurement Details:**

* Interested suppliers may submit a Statement of Capabilities by April 23, 2024, at 14:00 hours
* The Statement of Capabilities must clearly demonstrate how the supplier meets the requirements outlined above
* The contracting officer, Jason Ginn, can be reached at (819) 576-5478 for inquiries
* The contract value, including optional quantities, is estimated at CAD $1,256,314.70
* The contract duration will be 30 days for initial quantities, and 6 months for optional quantities

**Pre-identified Supplier:**
SAVIT Corporation has been identified as the only supplier with Intellectual Property Rights incorporated in the ammunition pouch that meets or exceeds all mandatory requirements outlined by the Department of National Defence.

Should any supplier consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the goods listed above, please submit a Statement of Capabilities to Jason Ginn by the closing date
